bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this Act:

bcl:text.#text:
means the person designated by the minister to perform
            the duties of administrator under this Act;

, if used to indicate a relationship between corporations,
            means any corporation where one is the subsidiary of the other, or both are subsidiaries
            of the same corporation or each of them is controlled by the same person or the same
            group of persons or one or more members of an associated group of persons;
has the same meaning as "annuitant" in the  (Canada);

, if used to indicate a relationship with a person,
            means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a corporation of which the person owns, directly or indirectly, shares
              carrying 10% or more of the voting rights attached to all outstanding shares of the
              corporation,
a partner of the person,
a participant in a joint venture with the person,
a trust or estate

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
in which the person has, in the opinion of the administrator, a substantial
                beneficial interest, or
for which the person serves as trustee or in a similar capacity,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a spouse, parent, grandparent, child, grandchild, brother or sister of the
              person, or

a parent, grandparent, child, grandchild, brother or sister of the spouse of
              the person residing in the same residence;

bcl:text.#text:
means an associated group of persons as
            defined in the regulations;

means a person authorized by the administrator
            to act as an authorized depository under this Act;

means the memorandum and articles or other
            constitutional documents of a corporation;

includes a mortgage, bond, debenture, note, loan or
            similar obligation, whether secured or unsecured;
means

bcl:text: that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a corporation, whether a cooperative association or not, or
a partnership

pays at least 50% of its wages and salaries, calculated in the prescribed
              manner, to employees who regularly work in British Columbia,

has, together with its prescribed affiliates or prescribed associates, less
              than $50 million in total assets calculated in the prescribed manner,

is not substantially engaged, as determined in the prescribed manner, in any
              prescribed ineligible activities, and
meets other prescribed criteria;

bcl:text.#text:
means an individual who, at the time of subscribing
            for a share under this Act, is resident in British Columbia and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
is employed by the corporation that has registered an employee share ownership
              plan, or the predecessor or affiliate of that corporation, on a continuing basis for
              an average of at least 20 hours each week,
is not a major shareholder of the corporation, and
meets other prescribed conditions;

bcl:text.#text:
means an investment permitted under
            section 15;

means an individual who, at the time of subscribing
            for a share of an employee venture capital corporation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is resident in British Columbia,

is not a major shareholder of the employee venture capital corporation and, in
              the case of an employee venture capital corporation that has a restricted
              constitution, is not a major shareholder of any of the corporations that the employee
              venture capital corporation is restricted to investing in by its constitution,
              and
meets other prescribed conditions;

bcl:text.#text: means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a share of any kind,

a debt security that does not have conventional, periodic payments of
              principal and interest before maturity and that is

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
subordinated to the rights of other creditors, other than prescribed
                creditors, or

otherwise substantially at risk, as determined in the prescribed
                manner,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a partnership interest or unit,
a royalty interest,

a trust unit, if the trust property consists primarily of eligible
              securities,

a right, option or warrant to acquire a security that is an eligible
              security,

another security the administrator considers to be similar in character to a
              security referred to in paragraphs (a) to (f), or
another security as may be prescribed;

bcl:text.#text:
means an eligible investor who owns shares
            purchased under an employee venture capital plan;

means those employees who have been certified as an
            employee group under section 27;
means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a trade union,
an association or federation of trade unions,

a corporation owned and controlled by one or more trade unions or associations
              or federations of trade unions, or
a prescribed association of employees;

bcl:text.#text:
means a plan containing the provisions
            referred to in section 4;

means an eligible employee who owns shares
            purchased under an employee share ownership plan;

means a corporation registered
            under section 8;

means a plan containing the provisions
            referred to in section 10;

means the consideration in money received by a
            corporation for the corporation's issued equity shares;
means a share of a class of shares that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: carry voting rights under all circumstances,

are not restricted in their right to share in the profits of the corporation
              or in the division of the corporation's assets on its being liquidated, dissolved or
              otherwise wound up, and

do not have any rights and restrictions prescribed in the
              regulations;

bcl:text.#text: means

bcl:text:
in which an employee venture capital corporation has previously made an eligible
            investment;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a corporation, whether a cooperative association or not, or
a partnership

bcl:text.#text:
means, with respect to a corporation, a person who,
            together with his or her associates, owns, directly or indirectly, shares carrying 10%
            or more of the voting rights attached to all outstanding shares of the corporation or
            shares of the corporation carrying 10% or more of the right to share in the profits of
            the corporation or in the division of its assets on its being liquidated, dissolved or
            otherwise wound up;

means an employee share ownership plan or an employee venture
            capital plan;
includes to purchase or otherwise acquire;

means a prospectus, offering memorandum or
            other material, in a form and containing information satisfactory to the administrator,
            that is delivered to eligible employees or eligible investors in connection with
            obtaining subscriptions for shares;
means a person who

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is married to another person, or

is living with another person in a marriage-like relationship, and has lived
              in that relationship for a continuous period of 6 months;

bcl:text.#text: means

a trust governed by a registered retirement savings plan as defined in the
                 (Canada),

a trust governed by a registered retirement income fund as defined in the
                 (Canada),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a trust, in a form and on terms approved by the administrator, established for
              the purpose of acquiring or holding shares issued under a plan, or
other prescribed trusts;

bcl:text.#text: means a disposition of a share

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
to a trust for which the transferor or the transferor's spouse is the
              annuitant or beneficiary,
from a trust to the annuitant or beneficiary of the trust,

from one trust to another trust if both trusts have the same annuitant or
              beneficiary, or
in other prescribed circumstances.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Act

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
shares are deemed to be owned by an individual if they are beneficially owned by
            a corporation controlled by the individual or by an affiliate of that
            corporation,

a corporation is deemed to own shares that are owned by its affiliates,
            and

the annuitant or beneficiary of a trust is deemed to have purchased, held or
            disposed of shares that are purchased, held or disposed of by the trust.

bcl:text.#text:
If, under the definition of , a person (the "first
          person") is an affiliate of another person, that other person is an affiliate of the first
          person.

If, under the definition of , a person (the "first
          person") is an associate of another person, that other person is an associate of the first
          person.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purposes of this Act

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a corporation is deemed to be controlled by a person or group of persons
            if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
shares of the corporation carrying more than 50% of the outstanding voting
              rights for the election of the directors are owned directly or indirectly by that
              person or group of persons, and

the voting rights carried by the shares referred to in subparagraph
                (i) are sufficient, if exercised, to elect a majority of the directors of
              the corporation, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a person or group of persons is deemed, other than in prescribed circumstances,
            to own shares that the person or group of persons would own following the exercise
            of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an option, warrant or right, or

a conversion right that is attached to a debt obligation or to a share of the
              corporation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purposes of this Act and subject to subsection (7), if the expression
          "controlled, directly or indirectly in any manner," is used, a corporation must be
          considered to be so controlled by another corporation, person or group of persons (the
          "controller") at any time if, at that time, the controller has any direct or indirect
          influence that, if exercised, would result in control in fact of the
          corporation.

If the corporation and the controller are dealing with each other at arm's length
          and that influence is derived from a franchise, licence, lease, distribution, supply or
          management agreement or other similar agreement or arrangement, the main purpose of which
          is to govern the relationship between the corporation and the controller regarding the
          manner in which a business carried on by the corporation is to be conducted, the
          corporation must not be considered to be controlled, directly or indirectly in any manner,
          by the controller merely because of the agreement or arrangement.

A reference in this Act to a series of transactions or events includes any related
          transactions or events completed in contemplation of the series.

A corporation that meets the criteria set out in section 3 may apply to have an
            employee share ownership plan registered under this Part by delivering to the
            administrator, in a form acceptable to the administrator, an application including all
            of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the financial statements of the corporation;
a copy of its constitution;
a copy of the employee share ownership plan;

other information that the administrator may require in order to determine
              compliance with this Act and the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The administrator must register an employee share ownership plan, with
            conditions that the administrator considers appropriate, on being satisfied
            that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the corporation meets the criteria set out in section 3,

the plan complies with the spirit and intent of this Act and the regulations,
              and
any other prescribed conditions for the registration are met.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the administrator registers an employee share ownership plan he or she must
            issue a certificate of registration, and the plan is deemed to be registered under this
            Part on the date of registration contained in the certificate.

Registration of an employee share ownership plan under this section constitutes
            approval, as at the date of registration, for the corporation to raise the amount of
            equity capital referred to in the plan or any other amount that the administrator
            specifies.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The criteria referred to in section 2 for eligibility of a corporation, whether a
          cooperative association or not, are that the corporation

bcl:text.#text:
is incorporated under the laws of British Columbia or of Canada or, being a
            corporation incorporated in any other province of Canada, is an extraprovincial company
            within the meaning of the ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
pays not less than 25% of the prescribed wages and salaries, calculated in the
            prescribed manner, of the corporation to employees who regularly work within British
            Columbia,

together with its affiliates, has not more than $500 million in total assets
            calculated in the prescribed manner,

has not, during the preceding 2 years, raised more than $5 million in equity
            capital under

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: any registered employee share ownership plan,

any other share ownership plan that substantially meets the requirements under
                section 4
                (1) (c), (d) (i) and (h), or

combinations of share ownership plans referred to in subparagraph
              (i) or (ii), and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: meets other prescribed conditions.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Every employee share ownership plan must contain or make provision for at least
            the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the estimated number of eligible employees proposed to be covered by the
              plan;

the amount of equity capital to be raised under the plan, which must not
              exceed $5 million in any 2 year period;

that every eligible employee who has been employed by the corporation or its
              predecessor or affiliate for a period set out in the plan not exceeding 2 years has an
              equal right to purchase shares under the plan or a prorated right to purchase shares,
              which takes into account length of service;

subject to section 40 (5), that the shares to be acquired under
              the plan

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: are equity shares,
are of only one class and have never previously been issued,

will only be issued from the treasury of the corporation on being fully paid
                for in cash,

bcl:text.#text:
will, immediately following their acquisition, be registered in the name of
                each employee that purchases them or in the name of a trustee, if the shares are
                held by the trustee for the benefit of an employee, and despite the , will be held, for
                3 years from the date of the purchase, in the custody of an authorized depository
                and under such terms and conditions as are approved by the administrator,
                and

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: do not have any rights or restrictions prohibited by regulation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
an investment confirmation, to be issued to each new shareholder within
              30 days of share registration, setting out at least the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the number of shares acquired;
the price paid per share;
the total amount paid;

the name, address, telephone number and contact person for the authorized
                depository;

the procedure for obtaining the tax credit certificate under this
                Act;
any other prescribed information;

bcl:text: a method of establishing the value for the shares by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an opinion from an independent qualified person,

a formula referencing financial information of the corporation,
                or

a formula referencing the trading value of a class of shares trading on a
                public stock exchange of the corporation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
that the corporation must provide to each employee shareholder at least
              annually

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
the value established under paragraph (f), and the basis
                on which the value is established, and

disclosure with respect to major decisions of the corporation that
                materially affect that value;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
that if a shareholder wishes to sell all or a portion of the shares acquired
              under the plan and the shares are not listed on a stock exchange the corporation must
              redeem the shares unless

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
the shares are bought by a party dealing at arm's length with the
                shareholder, or
the shares are acquired by other eligible employees;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
that shares redeemed under paragraph (h) will be at a price at least equal to
              the value established under paragraph (f);
a share offering document;

the use of the equity capital where the use will be contrary to section 6
                (a);
such other requirements as may be prescribed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A plan must not be altered without the prior approval of the administrator and
            the consent of a majority of the employee shareholders.

If a corporation proposes to raise equity capital under an employee share
            ownership plan in addition to the equity capital approved under section 2
              (4), it must apply to the administrator who may approve that additional
            equity capital, subject to any conditions the administrator considers appropriate, if
            the administrator is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the corporation meets the criteria referred to in section 3,

the plan is being implemented in accordance with this Act and the regulations,
              and

the equity capital approval would not result in the total aggregate of the tax
              credits exceeding any limits prescribed under section 30.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An approval under subsection (1) is deemed to be an approved change to
            the plan.

bcl:text.#text:
A corporation must not use funds received from the approved issue of shares under
          an employee share ownership plan for which tax credits under the  have been or will be claimed

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: unless otherwise specifically provided for in the plan, for

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: lending, other than in the ordinary course of business,

acquiring securities, other than in the ordinary course of
              business,

funding of all or part of the purchase by the corporation of all or a
              substantial portion of the assets of an existing proprietorship, partnership, joint
              venture, trust or corporation,

making any payment, including a payment for the purchase of goods or services
              and the payment of dividends and the repayment of shareholder debt, to a shareholder,
              director or officer of the corporation or any of its affiliates,

investing in land, unless the use of the land is incidental or ancillary to
              the activities of the corporation, and

the purchase or redemption of previously issued shares of the corporation or
              one of its affiliates,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
for purchasing services or assets provided by the Crown or an agency or
            corporation of the Crown, if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
those services or assets are to be used in all or in part in a business or
              activity that is the same or similar to the activity previously carried on by the
              Crown or the agency or corporation of the Crown, and

the corporation has received, either directly or indirectly, any financial
              assistance from any government, municipality or public authority with respect to the
              acquisition of those services or assets,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
as part of a transaction or series of transactions directly or indirectly
            involving the funding of all or part of the purchase by the corporation of any services
            or assets at a price that is greater than the fair market value of the services or
            assets purchased, or
for other prescribed purposes.

bcl:text.#text:
A corporation must apply, on behalf of each of its eligible employees, to the
            administrator for a tax credit certificate entitling each of those eligible employees to
            a tax credit under section 13.1 of the , equal to 20% of the amount received by the corporation, in
            that calendar year or within 60 days immediately following that calendar year, for
            shares issued to those eligible employees by the corporation under a registered employee
            share ownership plan.

On receipt of an application under subsection (1), the
            administrator must, subject to subsections (2.1) and (3), following the approval of
            the minister responsible for the administration of the  and in accordance with section 13.1 of the , issue a tax credit certificate in the amount referred
            to in subsection (1), unless the administrator considers that the corporation or
            its directors, officers or shareholders are conducting the business or affairs of the
            corporation in a manner that is contrary to the spirit and intent of this Act whether or
            not there has been a contravention of this Act or the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the administrator has made an order under section 40 (5) (c) in respect of
            the registered employee share ownership plan and the amount referred to in subsection
            (1) exceeds $2 000 for the calendar year or the 60 days immediately following that
            calendar year, the administrator must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
issue a tax credit certificate in the amount of $2 000 for the
              year,

issue tax credit certificates in subsequent years in an amount not exceeding
              $2 000 per year until the aggregate of the tax credit certificates issued in respect
              of that year equals the amount referred to in subsection (1) for that year,
              and

after all tax credit certificates have been issued under paragraphs (a) and
              (b), issue tax credit certificates in accordance with this section for any amounts
              referred to in subsection (1) that are received by the corporation
              in the subsequent years.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The administrator must not issue a tax credit certificate under subsection
              (2) or (2.1) unless the administrator is satisfied
            that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the corporation and its eligible employees are complying with a registered
              employee share ownership plan and any conditions pertaining to it,
the shares have been acquired in accordance with a registered plan,

other than where prescribed, the shares do not constitute a type of security
              that entitles the holder, in respect of the acquisition of those shares,

bcl:text.#text:
to claim a tax credit under the  or the  (Canada), other
                than under section 13.1 of the  or section 127.4 of the  (Canada), against
                tax payable,

to claim a deduction from income under the  or the  (Canada),
                or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
to receive any other financial assistance from any government, municipality
                or public authority,

bcl:text.#text: no tax credit has been previously allowed for those shares under the  or the  (Canada),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: [Repealed 2003-4-1.]
any other prescribed conditions have been complied with.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A corporation that meets the criteria set out in section 9 may apply for
            registration under this Part by delivering to the administrator, in a form acceptable to
            the administrator, an application including all of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the financial statements of the corporation;
a copy of its constitution;
a copy of the employee venture capital plan;

other information that the administrator may require in order to determine
              compliance with this Act and the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The administrator must register the corporation, with conditions that the
            administrator considers appropriate, on being satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the corporation meets the criteria set out in section 9,

the employee venture capital plan complies with the spirit and intent of this
              Act and the regulations, and
any other prescribed conditions for the registration are met.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the administrator registers a corporation, he or she must issue a certificate
            of registration, and the employee venture capital corporation and employee venture
            capital plan is deemed to be registered under this Part on the date of registration
            contained in the certificate.

Registration of an employee venture capital corporation under this section
            constitutes approval, as at the date of registration, for the employee venture capital
            corporation to raise the amount of equity capital referred to in the plan or any other
            amount that the administrator specifies.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The criteria referred to in section 8 for eligibility of a corporation for
          registration as an employee venture capital corporation are that the
          corporation

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is incorporated under the laws of British Columbia,
is sponsored by an employee organization or an employee group,

is managed by a person who does not manage any other employee venture capital
            corporation,

bcl:text.#text:
has a name that includes "(EVCC)" immediately before the word or abbreviation
            required by section 23 (1) of the ,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
has never previously carried on business other than business related to
            obtaining registration under this Part,

has, or will have immediately after registration and afterwards, equity capital
            of at least $25 000,

has authorized share structure consisting of shares without par
            value,
has a constitution that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: restricts the business of the corporation to

bcl:clause.bcl:text:
making investments permitted under this Act and providing business
                expertise, managerial expertise or financial support to eligible businesses in which
                the employee venture capital corporation has made or proposes to make an eligible
                investment, and

providing information to and educating employees as to the role of capital
                in business, the value of equity investments to an employee and the rights and
                obligations of corporations and their shareholders,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: restricts the issue of the shares to eligible investors, and

prohibits the corporation from lending money, guaranteeing loans or providing
              other financial assistance to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: meets other prescribed conditions.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Every employee venture capital plan must contain or make provision for at least
            the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the estimated number of eligible investors proposed to be covered by the
              plan;
the amount of equity capital to be raised under the plan;

if the employee venture capital plan is for a corporation that has a
              restricted constitution, that every eligible investor who has, for a period set out in
              the plan of not more than 2 years, been employed by the eligible business referred to
              in the corporation's constitution or an affiliate of that eligible business, has an
              equal right, or a prorated right based on length of service, to purchase shares under
              the plan;
that the shares to be issued under the plan

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: are equity shares,
are of only one class and have never previously been issued,

will only be issued from the treasury of the corporation on being fully paid
                for in cash,

will, immediately following their issue, be registered in the name of each
                shareholder that purchases them or in the name of a trustee, if the shares are held
                by the trustee for the benefit of a shareholder, and
do not have any rights or restrictions prohibited by regulation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
an investment confirmation, to be issued to each new shareholder within
              30 days of share registration, setting out at least the following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the number of shares acquired;
the price paid per share;
the total amount paid;

the procedure for obtaining the tax credit certificate under this
                Act;
any other prescribed information;

bcl:text: a method of establishing the value for the shares by

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: an independent opinion from a qualified person, or
a formula referencing financial information of the corporation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
that the corporation must provide to each shareholder at least
              annually

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
the value established under paragraph (g), and the basis
                on which the value is established, and

disclosure with respect to major decisions of the corporation that
                materially affect that value;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
that if a shareholder wishes to sell all or a portion of the shares acquired
              under the plan and the shares are not listed on a Canadian stock exchange the
              corporation must redeem the shares unless

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
the shares are bought by a party dealing at arm's length with the
                shareholder, or
the shares are acquired by other eligible investors;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
that shares redeemed under paragraph (i) will be at a price at least equal to
              the value established under paragraph (g);
a share offering document;
an investment plan including

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the corporation's investment policy and philosophy, and
if known,

bcl:clause.bcl:text:
the names of the eligible businesses in which the corporation intends to
                  invest,
the amount and timing of the intended investment, and

any special conditions or rights to be associated with the equity shares
                  to be acquired;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the criteria under which persons subscribing for shares will qualify as
              eligible investors;
a corporate governance plan that includes

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: any prescribed governance policies and practices, and

any other governance policies and practices established by the
                corporation;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: such other requirements as may be prescribed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An employee venture capital plan must not be altered without the prior approval
            of the administrator and the consent of a majority of the eligible
            shareholders.

bcl:text.#text:
In this section,  has the same meaning
            as in the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An employee venture capital corporation must establish a permanent establishment
            in Canada within 30 days after being registered and must afterward maintain a permanent
            establishment in Canada.
An employee venture capital corporation

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
may establish and maintain only one permanent establishment in Canada,
              and

must not establish or maintain a permanent establishment outside of
              Canada.

bcl:text.#text:
The equity capital of an employee venture capital corporation, including the
            equity capital referred to in section 14, must not exceed $5 million if it is not a
            reporting issuer as defined in the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the Lieutenant Governor in Council considers it to be in the public interest,
            he or she, by order with or without conditions, may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
exempt an employee venture capital corporation specified in the order from the
              $5 million limit under subsection (1), and

specify another limit applicable to that employee venture capital
              corporation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An employee venture capital corporation with a restricted
            constitution

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
must invest an amount equal to at least 80% of any equity capital it has
              raised during its fiscal year in eligible investments no later than the end of its
              next fiscal year, and

must afterwards keep at least the amount invested under paragraph
                (a) in eligible investments.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An employee venture capital corporation that does not have a restricted
            constitution

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
must invest an amount equal to at least a prescribed percentage of the equity
              capital it has raised during its fiscal year in accordance with a prescribed schedule,
              and

must afterwards keep at least the prescribed percentage of the equity capital
              referred to in paragraph (a) in eligible investments.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purposes of subsections (1) and (2), the amount invested in
            eligible investments must be ascertained using the cost, determined in the prescribed
            manner, of the investment.

Despite subsection (2), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may postpone
            prescribing both the percentage and the schedule referred to in subsection
              (2) for a period not exceeding one year following the coming into force of
            this section, in order to allow for consultation as to the intended regulations under
              subsection
              (2).

For the period before the Lieutenant Governor in Council prescribes the
            percentage and the schedule referred to in subsection (2) (a), the
            administrator by written order must specify for the purposes of subsection (2), and keep
            available for public inspection, both the percentage and the schedule referred to in
              subsection
              (2) (a).

If a corporation proposes to raise equity capital under an employee venture
            capital plan in addition to the capital approved under section 8 (4), it must apply to
            the administrator who may approve that additional capital, subject to any conditions the
            administrator considers appropriate if the administrator is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the corporation meets the criteria referred to in section 9,

the plan is being implemented in accordance with this Act and the regulations,
              and

the equity capital approval would not result in the total aggregate of the tax
              credits exceeding any limits prescribed under section 30.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An approval under subsection (1) is deemed to be an approved change to
            the employee venture capital plan.

An investment by an employee venture capital corporation is an eligible
            investment if the following requirements are met at the time the investment is
            made:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the investment consists of the acquisition

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
of eligible securities of an eligible business directly from the eligible
                business,

in prescribed circumstances, of eligible securities of an eligible business
                from an agent or broker acting as an underwriter for the eligible
                business,

of eligible securities of an affiliate or associate of an eligible business
                directly from the affiliate or associate, and the funds paid by the employee venture
                capital corporation for the eligible securities are in turn invested in eligible
                securities of the eligible business by the affiliate or associate either directly or
                indirectly through one or more other affiliates or associates,

of eligible securities of an eligible business or an affiliate or associate
                of an eligible business from an existing investor who owns those securities, and the
                administrator considers that the purchase of the eligible securities will

bcl:clause.bcl:text:
assist the eligible business in dealing with the departure of an employee
                  investor or a venture capital investor,

facilitate an orderly succession if an owner of an eligible business is
                  retiring, or

provide some other substantial economic benefit to the eligible business
                  or to British Columbia, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: of eligible securities in other prescribed circumstances;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the investment is not prohibited under sections 16 to 19;

in the case of an employee venture capital corporation that has a restricted
              constitution, the investment is in equity shares of the eligible business or
              affiliated businesses referred to in the employee venture capital corporation's
              constitution;
such other requirements as may be prescribed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If an eligible security acquired as an eligible investment  is converted or
            exchanged for another eligible security of the same investee business or an affiliate or
            associate of the investee business, the eligible security acquired on the conversion or
            exchange is an eligible investment.

bcl:text.#text:
An employee venture capital corporation must not use funds raised through the
            issue of equity shares with respect to which tax credits have been or are entitled to be
            claimed under section 13.1 of the  to make or hold an investment in an eligible business if all
            or part of the proceeds of that investment are directly or indirectly used or intended
            to be used by the eligible business

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
for lending, other than in exchange for eligible securities of an affiliate or
              an associate which is an eligible business,
for acquiring securities other than

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
eligible securities from an affiliate or an associate which is an eligible
                business, or

eligible securities approved by the administrator under section 17
                  (2),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
for making any payment with respect to the purchase of goods or services from,
              the payment of dividends to or the repayment of shareholder debt to a director,
              officer or shareholder of the employee venture capital corporation or from or to an
              associate of a director, officer or major shareholder of the employee venture capital
              corporation,

for purchasing services or assets provided by the Crown or an agency or
              corporation of the Crown, if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
those services or assets are to be used in all or in part in a business or
                activity that is the same or similar to the activity previously carried on by the
                Crown or the agency or corporation of the Crown, and

the corporation has received, either directly or indirectly, any financial
                assistance from any government, municipality or public authority with respect to the
                acquisition of those services or assets,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
as part of a transaction or series of transactions directly or indirectly
              involving, other than as part of a proposal accepted under section 17
                (2),

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
the purchase or redemption of previously issued shares of the eligible
                business or one of its affiliates,

the retirement of any part of a liability to a shareholder of the eligible
                business or one of its affiliates,
the payment of dividends, or

the funding of all or part of the purchase by the eligible business of all
                or a substantial portion of the assets of an existing proprietorship, partnership,
                joint venture, trust or corporation,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
for funding all or part of the purchase by the eligible business of any
              services or assets at a price that is greater than the fair market value of the
              services or assets purchased, or
for other prescribed purposes.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Despite subsection (1), the administrator may order, in respect of a particular
            eligible investment, that the eligible business may use all or part of the proceeds from
            the investment by an employee venture capital corporation for one or more of the
            purposes described in subsection (1) if the administrator is satisfied that
            the use would assist in the overall growth and development of the eligible
            business.

bcl:text:
Subject to subsection (2), an employee venture capital
            corporation that does not have a restricted constitution must not make or hold an
            investment in an eligible business if

bcl:text.#text:
the employee venture capital corporation or it and any other employee venture
            capital corporation or venture capital corporation registered under the , either alone or in conjunction
            with one or more of its or their

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
50% or more of the shares carrying votes for the election of directors of the
              eligible business are owned, directly or indirectly, by, or

the eligible business is controlled, directly or indirectly, in any manner,
              by
associates or affiliates,
shareholders or their associates or affiliates,
directors or their associates, or
officers or their associates.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Subsection
              (1) does not apply to the making or holding of an investment in an eligible
            business if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the administrator is satisfied that the investment will result in substantial
              employee participation in the

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: start up and operation of a new business, or

restructuring of ownership of an existing business to facilitate transfer of
                control from a person or a group of persons if the restructuring will result in
                widely dispersed ownership by persons resident in Canada, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the administrator is satisfied that the eligible business is or will be in
              financial difficulty.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The administrator may set conditions with respect to the making or holding of an
            investment under subsection (2).

An employee venture capital corporation must not make or hold an investment in
            an eligible business if a major shareholder of the employee venture capital corporation
            is, or was at any time during the 2 years immediately preceding the
            investment,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a major shareholder of the eligible business,
an associate of a major shareholder of the eligible business,

a voting trust where the trustee votes shares of the eligible business,
              or

the eligible business or an associate or affiliate of the eligible
              business.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An employee venture capital corporation must not make or hold an investment in
            an eligible business if the eligible business or an associate, affiliate, director,
            officer or shareholder of the eligible business provides or has provided, directly or
            indirectly, as part of any transaction or series of transactions, a loan, guarantee or
            any other financial assistance to a person who is, or was at any time during the 2 years
            immediately preceding the investment,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the employee venture capital corporation,

an associate or affiliate of the employee venture capital
              corporation,

a director, officer or major shareholder of the employee venture capital
              corporation, or

a member of a group of persons that controls the employee venture capital
              corporation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An employee venture capital corporation must not make or hold an investment in
            an eligible business if, as a result of that investment, the aggregate of all amounts
            received directly or indirectly by that eligible business from the employee venture
            capital corporation would exceed $10 million within a 2 year period.

Subsection
              (1) does not apply if the amount that the eligible business receives in
            excess of $10 million within a 2 year period is an investment made or held by an
            employee venture capital corporation that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
is invested in accordance with section 22 (1) (c),
              and

does not have to be invested in eligible investments under the terms of the
              corporation's employee venture capital plan.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Action to be taken if investment becomes prohibited
bcl:section.bcl:text:
If an investment of an employee venture capital corporation becomes prohibited
          under sections 16 to 19, the employee venture capital corporation must, within 6 months
          after the investment became prohibited, dispose of that investment unless, within the 6
          month period, the circumstances that caused the investment to become prohibited change so
          that the investment is no longer prohibited under those sections.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An employee venture capital corporation must not make or hold any investments
            other than investments in

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: eligible investments,

liquid reserves on deposit in British Columbia at a savings
              institution,

bcl:text.#text: a security, as defined in the ,

bcl:text:
if, at the date of the investment, the money invested in the security is not
              required under the Act to ever be invested in eligible investments,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
of an eligible business or an affiliate or associate of an eligible
                business,

of an investee business or an affiliate or associate of an investee
                business, or

issued to the employee venture capital corporation on the disposition of an
                eligible investment or an investment permitted under this section

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the investment protection account under section 23,

bcl:text.#text:
securities, as defined by the , that are issued by the government or the government of
              Canada, or

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: any other prescribed investment.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The annual expenses of an employee venture capital corporation must not exceed a
            prescribed amount, determined in the prescribed manner.

At the time of each receipt of equity capital for which a tax credit certificate
            will be applied for under this Act or on the disposition of an equity share that is or
            was an eligible investment, an employee venture capital corporation must pay or cause to
            be paid into an investment protection account that meets the criteria and complies with
            the conditions established by the administrator an amount equal to 30% of the
            consideration received by the employee venture capital corporation for the equity
            shares, unless the administrator is satisfied that the employee venture capital
            corporation will immediately make an eligible investment equal to or greater than the
            consideration received.

bcl:text:
If an employee venture capital corporation has made or proposes to immediately
            make an investment and the administrator is satisfied that

the administrator must authorize payment out of the investment protection
            account to the employee venture capital corporation or its nominee, with or without
            conditions the administrator may require, of an amount equal to the least of the
            following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the investment qualifies as an eligible investment, and

the eligible business and the employee venture capital corporation and their
              directors, officers and shareholders are conducting their business and affairs in
              accordance with the spirit and intent of this Act,

the amount the employee venture capital corporation has requested to be
              released from the investment protection account;
either

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
if the amount paid or to be paid for the eligible investment is represented
                by equity raised by the employee venture capital corporation before July 30, 1996,
                50% of the amount paid or to be paid for the eligible investment, or

if the amount paid or to be paid for the eligible investment is represented
                by equity raised by the employee venture capital corporation on or after July 30, 1996, 37.5% of the amount paid or to be paid for the eligible investment;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the amount in the account.

bcl:text: If
the money must be paid to the Minister of Finance.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the administrator certifies that money is payable to the Crown under
              section 31 or 32, and

there is money in the investment protection account to pay all or part of the
              amount payable,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Income earned on money in the investment protection account is payable to the
            employee venture capital corporation.

Despite subsection (4), the administrator may require an employee venture capital
            corporation to pay or cause to be paid to the Crown all or part of the income earned in
            respect of the investment protection account if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the registration of the corporation is revoked under section 35, or
the corporation fails to comply with section 13.

bcl:text.#text:
If an employee venture capital corporation acquires shares of its own issue and
            the administrator is satisfied that no tax credits under section 13.1 of the  or section 127.4 of the  (Canada) have been or
            will be issued in respect of those shares, the administrator may authorize the payment
            out of the investment protection account to the employee venture capital corporation or
            its nominee of an amount equal to the lesser of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
40% of the amount for which the shares acquired were originally issued,
              or

the amount deposited in the investment protection account in respect of the
              shares acquired.

bcl:text.#text:
An employee venture capital corporation must apply, on behalf of each of its
            eligible investors, to the administrator for a tax credit certificate entitling each of
            those eligible investors to a tax credit under section 13.1 of the , equal to 15% of the amount received by the corporation,
            in that calendar year or within 60 days immediately following that calendar year, for
            shares issued to those eligible investors by the corporation under a registered employee
            venture capital plan.

On receipt of an application under subsection (1), the
            administrator must, subject to subsections (2.1) and (3), following the approval of
            the minister responsible for the administration of the  and in accordance with section 13.1 of the , issue a tax credit certificate in the amount referred
            to in subsection (1), unless the administrator considers that the corporation or
            its directors, officers or shareholders are conducting the business or affairs of the
            corporation in a manner that is contrary to the spirit and intent of this Act whether or
            not there has been a contravention of this Act or the regulations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the administrator has made an order under section 40 (5) (d) in respect of
            the registered employee venture capital plan and the amount referred to in subsection
            (1) exceeds $2 000 for the calendar year or the 60 days immediately following that
            calendar year, the administrator must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
issue a tax credit certificate in the amount of $2 000 for the
              year,

issue tax credit certificates in subsequent years in an amount not exceeding
              $2 000 per year until the aggregate of the tax credit certificates issued in respect
              of that year equals the amount referred to in subsection (1) for that year,
              and

after all tax credit certificates have been issued under paragraphs (a) and
              (b), issue tax credit certificates in accordance with this section for any amounts
              referred to in subsection (1) that are received by the corporation
              in the subsequent years.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The administrator must not issue a tax credit certificate under subsection
              (2) or (2.1) unless the administrator is satisfied
            that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the corporation and its eligible investors are complying with a registered
              employee venture capital plan and any conditions pertaining to it,
the shares have been acquired in accordance with a registered plan,

other than where prescribed the shares do not constitute a type of security
              that entitles the holder, in respect of the acquisition of those shares,

bcl:text.#text:
to claim a tax credit under the  or the  (Canada), other
                than under section 13.1 of the  or section 127.4 of the  (Canada), against
                tax payable,

to claim a deduction from income under the  or the  (Canada),
                or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
to receive any other financial assistance from any government, municipality
                or public authority,

bcl:text.#text: no tax credit has been previously allowed for those shares under the  or the  (Canada),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: [Repealed 2000-9-9.]
any other prescribed conditions have been complied with.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
An employee venture capital corporation, subject to its memorandum, notice of
          articles or articles,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: may allot or issue fractional shares for any purpose, and

may purchase or redeem any of its fractional shares and need not consolidate
            them into whole shares.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An employee venture capital corporation may elect to maintain a separate paid up
            capital account for each class and series of shares that it issues, and must, from the
            date of that election, maintain those accounts in accordance with this
            section.

An employee venture capital corporation must add to the paid up capital account
            maintained for a class or series of shares

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the full amount, without supplement or deduction, of any consideration
              received by the employee venture capital corporation for the issue of shares of that
              class or series of shares, whether those shares were issued before or after the
              creation of the account, and

any other amounts, including, without limitation, amounts credited to a
              retained earnings or other surplus account that may be approved,

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
in the case of an employee venture capital corporation that has outstanding
                shares of more than one class or series of shares, by special resolution,
                or
in any other case, by the directors.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Despite subsection (2) (a), if it is authorized to do so by a special resolution,
            an employee venture capital corporation may, in respect of a specific issue of shares,
            add less to the paid up capital account maintained for the class or series of shares out
            of which the shares were issued than the full amount of the consideration it received
            for the issue of those shares.

An employee venture capital corporation must not reduce the balance in any paid
            up capital account except as provided for in this section.

An employee venture capital corporation must deduct from the paid up capital
            account maintained for a class or series of shares

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
if shares of that class or series of shares are purchased, redeemed or
              otherwise acquired by the employee venture capital corporation and are subsequently
              cancelled, the amount of the paid up capital that is attributable to those purchased,
              redeemed or acquired shares, and

bcl:text.#text:
the amount by which capital in respect of those shares is reduced under
              section 74 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
On a conversion, exchange or change of issued shares of an employee venture
            capital corporation into shares of another class or series of shares of the employee
            venture capital corporation, the employee venture capital corporation must

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
deduct from the paid up capital account maintained for the class or series of
              shares of which the shares converted, exchanged or changed formed a part, the amount
              of the paid up capital that is attributable to those converted, exchanged or changed
              shares, and

add to the paid up capital account maintained for the class or series of
              shares into which the shares were converted, exchanged or changed

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
an amount equal to the amount referred to in paragraph (a),
                and

any additional consideration the employee venture capital corporation
                receives as a result of the conversion, exchange or change.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purposes of subsections (5) (a) and (6) (a), the amount of paid up
            capital that is attributable to the shares referred to in those subsections as having
            been purchased, redeemed, acquired, converted, exchanged or changed, as the case may be,
            is the result obtained by

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
multiplying the balance in the paid up capital account maintained for the
              class or series of shares of which the shares referred to in subsections (5)
                (a) and (6) (a) formed a part by the number of the shares of that class
              or series of shares that were purchased, redeemed, acquired, converted, exchanged or
              changed, and

dividing the result of the calculation referred to in paragraph
                (a) by the number of issued shares of that class or series of shares that
              were outstanding immediately before the purchase, redemption, acquisition, conversion,
              exchange or change.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A group of employees who the administrator considers are or will be eligible
            investors or eligible employees may apply to the administrator for certification as an
            employee group for the purposes of this Act.

The administrator may certify, with or without conditions, not more than one
            employee group with respect to each employee share ownership plan or employee venture
            capital plan.

A corporation that meets the requirements of section 3 or 9 and that has not
            more than 150 employees, calculated in the prescribed manner, and an employee group, may
            each apply in a form and manner satisfactory to the administrator for reimbursement, in
            accordance with subsection (2), of their costs relating to the negotiation, evaluation
            and implementation of an employee share ownership plan or employee venture capital
            plan.

If the administrator approves an application under subsection (1), the government
            must reimburse the corporation and the employee group for 50% of their respective costs
            up to a prescribed maximum amount, if the administrator is satisfied that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the corporation and the employee group are complying with the spirit and
              intent of the Act, and
the costs incurred comply with any prescribed terms and conditions.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Only one application for each corporation and employee group may be approved by
            the administrator in any calendar year.

The administrator must maintain a register containing the information required
            by subsection
              (3).

The register must be open for public inspection during normal business hours at
            places in British Columbia determined by the administrator.
The register must contain the following information:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the name and registered office of each corporation that caused a plan to be
              registered and the place at which all documents, other than documents containing
              financial information of the corporation, pertaining to the plan may be
              examined;
the date that the plan was registered;

a contact name and address for any employee group associated with the plan if
              any;
other information that may be prescribed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The Lieutenant Governor in Council, for any year, may make regulations as
            follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
prescribing an amount as the annual maximum employee investment tax
              credit;

subdividing the annual maximum employee investment tax credit into smaller
              annual maximum amounts, that may differ from each other, and allocating each of those
              smaller annual maximum amounts for corporations according to which of the criteria
              specified under paragraph (c) apply to them;

for paragraph (b), specifying criteria applicable to corporations, which
              criteria may differentiate among corporations on any basis the Lieutenant Governor in
              Council considers appropriate, including but not limited to one or more of the
              following:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text:
whether the corporations have or do not have restricted
                constitutions;

the value, or the reported value, of the total consolidated assets of each
                of the corporations;

the level of the approved equity capital of each of the
                corporations;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
authorizing the administrator, in circumstances and on conditions that may be
              prescribed, to reallocate part of an amount allocated under paragraph
                (b) for corporations, regardless of which of the criteria prescribed
              under paragraph (c) apply to the corporations.

bcl:text.#text:
The administrator must register a plan only if satisfied that the amounts that
            will be deductible or deducted under section 13.1 of the  during a particular year

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
do not exceed the annual maximum employee investment tax credit for that year,
              and
are within the allocations made under subsection (1).

bcl:text:
If, because of a regulation made under subsection (1) or a reallocation referred
            to in subsection (1) (d), continuation of plans registered under this Act would
            result in the level of the approved equity capital, for the corporations to which the
            plans apply, exceeding

the administrator must amend the plans by reducing the corporations' approved
            equity capital to reflect the regulation or reallocation, with effect as of the
            effective date of the regulation or reallocation, as the case may be.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the annual maximum employee investment tax credit, or

a smaller annual maximum amount allocated under subsection (1) (b) for
              corporations meeting criteria applicable to them as specified under subsection (1) (c),

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An agreement, arrangement or approval, whether made before or after the coming
            into force of this subsection, is, and has always been, without effect to the extent, if
            any, that it requires or required or purports or purported to require the government,
            the administrator or any person on behalf of either of them, in relation to a plan or
            intended plan or to a tax credit or intended tax credit,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to do anything inconsistent with this Act or the regulations,
to exercise a discretion under this Act in a specified manner, or

to take any action toward achieving a specific outcome under this
              Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Repayment of tax credit — sale of shares

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If a person receives, directly or indirectly, the benefit of all or part of a
            tax credit in respect of which the person is not entitled, the person must immediately
            pay the amount of the benefit to the Minister of Finance.

bcl:text.#text:
Subject to subsection (3), a shareholder who disposes of shares in respect of
            which a tax credit was allowed under section 13.1 of the , must repay or cause to be repaid to the Minister of Finance
            an amount equal to the tax credits allowed in respect of those shares under section 13.1
            of the  or a lesser amount determined under the
            regulations in prescribed circumstances

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
if the shares were issued under an employee share ownership plan and the
              disposition is made within 3 years after the date of the issue of the shares,
              or

if the shares were issued under an employee venture capital plan and the
              disposition is made within 5 years after the date of the issue of the
              shares.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Subsection
              (2) does not apply if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the disposition is a trust disposition, or

a tax credit repayment under subsection (2) had previously
              been made in respect of the shares disposed of.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A person who acquires the beneficial ownership in the shares under a disposition
            referred to in subsection (2) is jointly and severally liable with the persons referred
            to in subsections (2) and (5) to make the repayment referred to in subsection
              (2).

If the person who acquires the shares or the beneficial ownership in the shares
            under a disposition referred to in subsection (2) is an associate or an affiliate of the
            corporation whose shares are being disposed of, that corporation is jointly and
            severally liable with the persons referred to in subsections (2) and (4) to make
            the repayment referred to in subsection (2).

bcl:text:
A director or officer of the corporation, a member of a group of persons that
            controls the corporation or a shareholder who controls the corporation who provides
            information that

is jointly and severally liable with a person from whom the repayment is due
            under section
              31 (1).

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the person knew or ought to have known was false or misleading at the time of
              providing the information, and

formed in whole or in part the basis for which a tax credit certificate was
              issued under this Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
A director or officer of the corporation, a member of a group of persons that
            controls the corporation or a shareholder who controls the corporation who authorizes,
            permits or acquiesces in a transaction or series of transactions or events that the
            person knew or ought to have known at the time of authorization, permission or
            acquiescence would render a corporation incapable of making a payment under section 23
              (5) is jointly and severally liable with the corporation for the amount of
            the repayment.

A director or officer of the corporation, a member of a group of persons that
            controls the corporation or a shareholder who controls the corporation who authorizes,
            permits or acquiesces in a transaction or series of transactions or events that result
            in the acquisition of a person's shares by the corporation or an associate or affiliate
            of the corporation is jointly and severally liable with the persons referred to in
            section 31 (4) and (5) for the amount of the repayment owing.

Within 180 days after the end of each of the corporation's fiscal years
            beginning after the end of the first fiscal year in which a plan is registered under
            section 2 or 8, as the case may be, the corporation that applied for registration must
            prepare and file with the administrator an annual return setting out the information
            required by the regulations.

Unless otherwise ordered by the administrator, subsection (1) does not
            apply

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
in the case of a corporation that has registered an employee share ownership
              plan, after 3 years have elapsed since the date of release of all shares held in
              custody under section 4, or

in the case of an employee venture capital corporation, after the fifth year
              following the payment of all funds from the investment protection account under
              section 23.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Each corporation that has had a plan registered and each employee group must
            maintain records in the form and containing the information that the administrator
            considers necessary to determine that this Act and the regulations are being complied
            with.

The corporation must keep the records at its records office or at another place
            in British Columbia that is approved by the administrator.

The administrator may suspend, for a period of up to 3 months, or revoke the
            registration of a plan or an employee venture capital corporation if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
the registration of the plan was obtained through fraud or through giving of
              false or misleading information by the corporation, employee group or anyone
              associated with the plan,

the corporation fails to comply with this Act, the regulations or the plan,
              whether or not the failure constitutes an offence, or

the administrator considers that the corporation or its directors, officers or
              shareholders are conducting the business or affairs of the corporation in a manner
              that is contrary to the spirit and intent of this Act and the regulations or the plan,
              whether or not there has been a contravention of this Act, the regulations or the
              plan.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The administrator must not revoke a registration without first notifying by
            registered mail his or her intent to the corporation that registered the plan and giving
            it, its representative and other persons that would be affected by the revocation the
            opportunity of making comment and, if required, being heard.

If a plan has been suspended under subsection (1), but the
            administrator, following a review, considers that the plan is being conducted in a
            manner that is consistent with the spirit and intent of this Act, the regulations and
            the plan, he or she may remove the suspension, either generally or subject to the
            conditions that he or she considers appropriate.
Despite subsection (2), the administrator may

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
revoke the registration of an employee share ownership plan, if the
              corporation that registered the plan and a majority of the employee shareholders
              request the revocation, or

revoke the registration of an employee venture capital corporation, if the
              corporation requests the revocation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
For the purpose of determining compliance with this Act and the regulations, the
            administrator or a person designated by the administrator may, during normal business
            hours, make an examination of the affairs of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
a corporation that has registered a plan, a person who is or was a shareholder
              of the corporation,
an employee group, or
an eligible business.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The administrator or person making the examination under this section is
            entitled, for the purposes of determining compliance with this Act and the regulations,
            to examine the records and securities of a person or other entity referred to in
              subsection
              (1), and may make copies of those records and securities.

The administrator by order may appoint a person to make whatever investigation
            the administrator considers appropriate for the administration of this Act and in the
            order must determine the scope of the investigation.

On application by the administrator or by an investigator appointed under
            subsection (1), and on being satisfied by information on oath that it is necessary and
            in the public interest for any purpose relating to an investigation under subsection (1), the Supreme Court may make an order authorizing the
            investigator

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
to enter into the premises or on the land of a person at any reasonable time
              for the purpose of carrying out an inspection or examination,

to require the production of any records, securities or things and to inspect
              or examine them, and

on giving a receipt, to remove any records, securities or things inspected or
              examined under paragraph (b) for the purpose of further inspection
              or examination.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An application for an order under subsection (2) must be made in
            the prescribed manner.

Unless the Supreme Court otherwise directs, an application for an order under
              subsection
              (2) may be

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: made without notice to any person, and
heard in private.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Inspection or examination under subsection (2) must be completed
            as soon as practical and the records, securities or things must be promptly returned to
            the person who produced them.

A person must not withhold, destroy, conceal or refuse to give any information
            or produce any record, security or thing reasonably required under this section by the
            investigator.

bcl:text: An investigator appointed under section 37 has the same power
as the Supreme Court has for the trial of civil actions.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to summon and enforce the attendance of witnesses,

to compel witnesses to give evidence on oath or in any other manner,
              and
to compel witnesses to produce records, securities and things

bcl:text: The failure or refusal of a witness

makes the witness, on application to the Supreme Court, liable to be committed
            for contempt as if in breach of an order or judgment of the Supreme Court.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to attend,
to take an oath,
to answer questions, or

to produce the records, securities and things in the person's custody or
              possession

bcl:section.bcl:text:
Every person appointed under section 37 must provide the administrator with a
          complete report of the investigation made including any transcript of evidence and
          material in the person's possession relating to the investigation.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the administrator does not register a plan or a corporation, or if the
            administrator does not approve additional equity capital, issue a tax credit certificate
            or authorize a payment under this Act, for which application is made, within 45 days
            after receipt of the application, the administrator is deemed to have refused
            it.

A calculation or determination under this Act may be based on projections that
            the administrator considers to be appropriate.

An amount required to be paid to the Minister of Finance under this Act is a
            debt due to the Crown.

If a person does not comply with this Act or the regulations but the
            administrator considers that the person is carrying out his or her business and affairs
            in a manner consistent with the spirit and intent of this Act and the regulations, the
            administrator may do all or any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: permit registration of a corporation or plan;

for any time that the administrator considers appropriate, refrain from
              revoking the registration of the corporation or plan;

issue a tax credit certificate under section 7 or 24 or approve a payment
              under section 28;

increase the amount that may be released from the investment protection
              account referred to in section 23;

reduce the amount that would otherwise be required to be deposited into the
              investment protection account referred to in section 23.

bcl:text:
If the administrator is satisfied that an investment will result in substantial
            employee participation in the restructuring of ownership of an existing
            business
the administrator may, with or without conditions, order

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
to facilitate transfer of control from a person or a group of persons if the
              restructuring will result in widely dispersed ownership by persons resident in Canada,
              or
if the business is or will be in financial difficulty

that section 4 (1) (d) (i) to (iii) does not apply in respect of a particular
              employee share ownership plan, or

that section 15 (1) (b) does not apply in respect of a particular employee
              venture capital plan.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If the administrator issues an order under subsection (5) in respect of a
            particular employee share ownership plan or employee venture capital plan, the
            administrator may issue tax credit certificates

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
under section 7 to each eligible employee who purchases equity shares under
              the employee share ownership plan, equal in aggregate to 20% of the amount paid by the
              eligible employee for the shares, but not exceeding $2 000 per year, or

under section 24 to each eligible investor who purchases equity shares under
              the employee venture capital plan, equal in aggregate to 15% of the amount paid by the
