              eligible investor for the shares, but not exceeding $2 000 per year.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
The administrator may extend, with or without conditions, the time limit for doing
          anything under this Act and may grant the extension even if the time limit to be extended
          has expired.

bcl:text.#text:
In this section,  means any of the
            following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the government;
an employee, agent or minister of the government;
the administrator;

a person designated or appointed under this Act by the
              administrator;

a person acting on behalf of or under the direction of the
              administrator.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Subject to subsection (3), no legal proceeding for damages lies
            or may be commenced or maintained against a protected person because of anything done or
            omitted

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
in the performance or intended performance of any duty under this Act,
              or
in the exercise or intended exercise of any power under this Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Subsection
              (2) does not apply to a protected person in relation to anything done or
            omitted by that person in bad faith.
A person commits an offence if the person does any of the following:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text:
makes a statement in any record, report, return, application, form or other
              document or information filed or furnished under this Act to the administrator or to a
              person conducting an examination, inquiry or investigation under section 36 that, at
              the time and in the light of the circumstances under which the statement is made, is
              false or misleading with respect to a material fact or that omits to state a material
              fact, the omission of which makes that statement false or misleading;

wilfully withholds, destroys or conceals a record or security referred to in
              section 36 (2);

impedes the investigator from entering premises under section 37 (2)
                (a);

authorizes, permits or acquiesces in respect of a share purchase, transfer or
              redemption that is contrary to a provision of this Act or the regulations;
contravenes section 34 or 37 (5);
fails to comply with section 33.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
If a corporation is convicted of an offence under subsection (1) (a) to
            (f),

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the court may impose a fine of up to $100 000, and

every director or officer of the corporation who authorized, permitted or
              acquiesced in the offence also commits the offence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
An individual who is convicted of an offence under subsection (1) (a) to (e), is
            liable to a maximum fine of $50 000 or to imprisonment for not more than one year, or to
            both the fine and imprisonment.

A person does not commit an offence under this section in relation to a
            statement made if the person did not know that the statement was false or misleading
            and, in the exercise of reasonable diligence, could not have known that the statement
            was false or misleading.

bcl:text.#text:
Section 5 of the  does not apply to this
            Act.

bcl:section.bcl:text:
Proceedings for an offence under this Act must not be commenced more than 2 years
          after the facts on which the proceedings are based first come to the knowledge of the
          administrator.

bcl:text.#text:
The Lieutenant Governor in Council may make regulations referred to in
            section 41 of the .

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
Without limiting subsection (1), the Lieutenant Governor in Council may
            make regulations as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: governing any matter that may be prescribed under this Act;
defining any word or expression used but not defined in this Act;

requiring any person to supply information or returns respecting any matter
              required in assessing compliance with this Act;

establishing periods of time to be taken into account in calculations or
              determinations under this Act, and varying periods set by this Act;

prescribing a method of establishing for purposes of this Act the value of
              assets of corporations with employee share ownership plans registered under Part 1 or
              corporations registered under Part 2 as employee venture capital
              corporations.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text:
The administrator may, by order, extend the time limit for doing anything under
            this Act, and may grant the extension even if the time limit to be extended has
            expired.

The regulations under subsections (1) and (2) may provide differently for
            corporations with different levels of approved equity capital.

The Lieutenant Governor in Council may, if the Lieutenant Governor in Council
            considers it in the public interest to do so and with or without conditions, order, in
            respect of a particular employee venture capital plan, that any or all of sections 9 (a) to (d) and (g) (ii), 10 (1) (e) and 13 do not apply.
